body.name: Close Her Eyes: An absolutely heart-racing crime thriller and mystery novel (Detective Josie Quinn Book 17)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #11,080 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #147 in Serial Killers #186 in Organized Crime Thrillers #251 in Murder

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Close Her Eyes
reviews.reviewText: Josie Quinn and her team are baffled by their lasted case, when a young woman’s body is found with only a head wound that doesn’t appear to be life threatening, but once in the medical examiner’s, a shocking discovery is made. How can it be that the medical examiner had the same mark from her ex husband from years ago? Surely not, it has been so long. But then another body, another mark, the same mark…er brand, yes a cattle brand. Someone is trying to send a message. Josie now has to visit the small, corrupt city that Anya left behind and connect the cases to solve the new ones. I have to admit this book was emotional to say the least and I might have cried. But as always, I definitely recommend this one and all of the Josie Quinn series

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must read!
reviews.reviewText: My eyes are still leaking! This was such a rollercoaster of a book. Even more tension and suspense than usual from a Josie Quinn tale. I honestly suspected everyone and yet wasn’t really sure who was guilty as the story unfolded. This might be the most well written installment in the series so far. Not just the mystery but the team and how they work together. I’ll definitely be thinking about this one for a long time to come.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Lisa Regan has done it again! She has written yet another book that kept me reading into the wee hours of the morning and not once did I regret it. I also love when she delves into the backstory of one of the characters we have come to know. This time it was Anya, the medical examiner.This book had multiple puzzles, murders from different times and places, that are connected. But Josie's crew (work and family) ferret out all the clues and when the pieces are put together, the reveal is a surprise. I will admit the multiple murders and all the various character names had me confused from time to time. Just a little trouble holding all of those names in my mind at the same time.I also have to admit this one made me cry...more than once. But...looking forward to #18.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heart-Wrenching, Terrifying and Compelling Suspense and Police Procedural
reviews.reviewText: I just have to tell you that this book was more than what I expected. I knew that it would be a good mystery, a great crime procedural and include well-developed old friends from previous books in the series. What I was not prepared for was how absorbing the mystery was, how deeply developed the characters were and how detailed the police procedures were. I got to know the characters more in this book, because it’s a deep dive into their hearts and souls. The plot is fast-paced and riveting, dealing with a serial killer who brands the victims and spreads them across several locations. Josie wants to find the person who killed young Sharon Eddy, especially for the sake of the woman’s grandmother who raised her. When medical examiner Anya Feist gets involved personally in the crimes, the story becomes totally unputdownable and gut-wrenching at times. I enjoyed the story but I must say that this is the only Josie Quinn book that I have read that caused me to cry because of what happens. Tears of grief and outrage were real for me, and I credit the author for making me so close to the action and the characters that it was so real to me. I hated the culprits, pitied the victims and sobbed at one special scene that I can’t go into because I don’t want to give anything away. This is a book with all the feels and so real that I had trouble putting it down even after I finished it. Intriguing and addictive, this is the best of the best…and Josie Quinn is the best!DisclaimerDisclosure of Material Connection: I received a complimentary copy of this book from the publisher via Netgalley. I was not required to write a positive review. All opinions expressed are my own. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission’s 16 CFR, Part 255, “Guidelines Concerning the Use of Testimonials and Endorsements in Advertising.”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I devoured this book. I didn't sleep much for two days while reading it because I couldn’t put it down. But that's okay, I’m not complaining! :)This book follows the medical examiner, Anya Feist, and reveals her story as an abuse survivor. Being an abuse survivor means living in constant fear that your past will come back and get you. Unfortunately, for Anya, that’s exactly what happens.Lisa’s descriptions of how abuse victims act and think are so on point that I was almost relieved. It was like validation, which I’m sure has to do with how Anya reacted to abuse. Everyone reacts to trauma differently, but I feel like Anya reacted similarly to how I did, and that makes me feel a little less crazy if that makes any sense at all.The world knows Lisa Regan is an excellent writer, it's a proven fact, but this book, the detail, and the intricate plot are so masterfully mapped out that I was left in awe of her skill and ability to tell a story. I don't know how she keeps up with it all, and I'm so glad she can! It pulled me in so completely.Even when I had to put the book down to do other things, I was able to jump right back into the story without missing a beat. This book has an extreme amount of detail and A LOT of characters to keep up with. She did a freaking fantastic job with this one! I loved it! I hate that a favorite character was killed off (not telling and not spoiling!), but I understand why. With a series this long, things must be done to keep it fresh, and I believe Lisa has done that.This is another five-star, excellent page-turner from Lisa Regan. It’s heart-stopping and, at times, so intense you’ll be afraid to keep reading, but you’ll also love every minute of it! I know I did!Just go get it, and you’ll see what I’m talking about!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Great product at a great price
reviews.reviewText: Great product at a great price
Another absolutely gripping story, I loved it and highly recommend it to anyone who has time to sit and read as it was so hard to put it down. Thank you Lisa
Well now what, not sure I like what happened in this book. Should be a warning as I was reading it at work.I won't spoil it just incase other's haven't read it yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Another brilliantly written Josie Quin thriller.I love the way all the main characters are in Ms Regan's books, I think it keeps the momentum going.The storyline is as always very fast paced with lots of action and adventure and death..A thorough enjoyable read and one of many in a great series.
